TopicTitle: There is no special burning effect of returning to the atmosphere

Articles.Content: There is no special burning effect of returning to the atmosphere
I believe this was turned off for EA.
Yes, heat's not quite ready yet, the launch patch notes specifically call out that they're still tuning it so its briefly disabled. For now, relish the fact that you can aerobrake anywhere, anytime.

2 hours ago, aheny said:

Are you able to aerobrake? I'm trying to figure out if dynamic pressure has any effect or if it's disabled

I'm not sure if I'm aerobraking or simply using the gravity of Kerbin to reduce Ap.

Gravity won’t change your AP if there is no atmosphere (using standard kerbal physics). With KSP1, and I expect KSP2 if you kept your orbit above 70 km at all time, your orbit will never change.
 

Without heat in the game (which to be fair to the devs I expect individual part heating is relatively tricky to get right) you don’t need to worry about reentry angle at all, just drop your orbit below 70 km and you’ll eventually hit the ground.
